reviews.text: For a strip of concrete on the side of a railway line, it's not half bad. If you want a more frequent service, walk down the road to Hove (5-10) mins. Bit dirty but apart from that, no complaints  :)

This station is a disgrace.  The ticket machine rarely works, the permission to travel machine has never worked, the weather shelters are tiny and do not have proper seating and the frequency of trains is too low.  

Update: Southern now pay for two ticket inspectors every morning. The money would be better spent on a station upgrade.

Southern Rail have failed. Again.
Aldrington station is the next stop from Hove station on the Worthing to Brighton line.  A small station with limited facilities.
Very few trains... even those ment to stop don't bother. Best bet get to Hove or Portslade...

Could do with a clean every now and then.
Two stars because of the nice sounding reverb in the tunnel.
